1.content:
You groan with the pain and dizziness that assault you as you begin to regain your senses. The last thing you remember is settling down for the night, when you were blinded by a flash of white light, which somehow knocked you unconscious. By the look of the blurry blue sky above you, you've been unconscious all night at the very least.

As you pick yourself up from the floor, you begin to realise that something isn't right. For starters, you've been moved, as you were certainly not on a patch of crumbling brown rocks last night. However, the scenery seems wrong, somehow. The trees appear to stretch into the air for hundreds of metres, and massive plants with long green leaves wave in the breeze. The crumbling rocks appear to go on for miles in all directions. You are still very confused, when suddenly a huge clue literally falls out of the sky...

A leaf.

A leaf several times your size. In comparison to you, it's as big as a bus. You look upwards to see where it came from, and suddenly something clicks in your mind. You look around wildly, as everything begins to make horrible sense. The trees seem to go upwards so far... Because you're so small that they seem to be enormous. The massive plants are actually... Tufts of grass. The rocks beneath you are actually specks of dirt on a dirt path. If you had to guess, you'd say that you're only 1cm tall! You look down at yourself, and are relieved to see that, apart from your sudden size change, you're still a perfectly ordinary...
1.title: The Lost Island

choices: Ace trainer with plenty of experience (Late teens, early twenties)
12.content:
Human female. Your glance downward reveals two naked breasts, heaving in panic. Looking back up, you realize that down the road a ways are your clothes, which appear gigantic.

Your discarded garb is a rather distinctive uniform that reveals you are an...
12.title: Human (female)

13.content: Yes, you're still a regular pokemon. As a matter of fact you're a (insert choice here), a very healthy (insert choice here).
13.title: Pokemon (male)

1312.content: You wake up under a palm tree and decided to look around...
1312.title: Riolu

13121.content: You look around the beach when you see.....
13121.title: The beach

131212.content: You See a fainted trainer laying on the sand and you think for a while and decided to......
131212.title: A fainted trainer

133.content: You are an eevee, or one of the eeveelutions, but which one?
133.title: Eeveelutions

13332.content:
You're a Vaporeon. Shiny blue skin, fishy fins for ears, a thin white ruff around your neck, and a long tail ending in a flipper. Perfect for diving underwater and swimming for hours. And what exactly am I doing out of water? you ponder to yourself. You can't quite remember so you just shrug if off and begin to walk in a random direction that might promise a wetter environment.

The sky above is endless and the warm sunlight feels good on your skin. The plants present a bit of a challenge, however, as you're more used to gliding between tall stalks of underwater kelp than clumsily padding between giant blades of glass. The large leaves bend and let you through as you muscle yourself onward, past tall green stems that bob with the weight of blossoming flowers.

After some minutes you reach a clearing in the grass. But there's something ahead of you. A very large leaf that's swaying in a funny way. It takes you a minute but you finally realize that it's not a plant at all, but rather the leafy tail of some very large Pokemon. A Pokemon that's walking towards you!

You stand in place, too afraid to move, until the grass-type Pokemon finally comes into full view. It's a...
13332.title: Vaporeon

choices: Leafeon wants to do ／something else／ to you...
133321.content:
The giant Leafeon stops in her tracks. Her large expressive brown eyes stare unblinkingly at you while her leafy tail sways lazily in the air. A silent tense moment passes before her eyes light up and she smiles.

"Hey I know who you are! You're a Vaporeon, aren't you!"

You fiddle with your white ruff and blush, nodding.

"Yes, a Vaporeon!" brown paws quake the ground and she steps closer towards you to get a better look, "When I was still an Eevee, my trainer let me choose what I wanted to evolve into. I really like water but I like plants a little bit more so I became a Leafeon! And it's a good thing I did too! I never knew that evolving into a Vaporeon makes you soooo tiny!"

"Um, actually, that's not true..." Leafeon sits down next to you. A rattling sound comes from a brown wicker basket on her back.

"Oh, what was that? You're going to have to be a little bit louder, it's really hard to hear you!"

"ACTUALLY, not all Vaporeons are as small as me!" you yell, waving your blue paws in the air for effect, "Just yesterday I was just as big as you are! But now, for some strange reason, I'm tiny!" Leafeon blinked in bewilderment.

"Oh. Does... does anyone else know that...you're this tiny?"

"Nope, not at all. And my friends know I like to go on long adventures alone, so probably no one's even looking for me yet!" That last detail was a bit unnecessary, you realize.

For a split second a strange look comes across the Leafeon's face, but in the blink of an eye it's replaced with her familiar friendly smile. She begins to speak and...
133321.title: It's a Leafeon!

choices: ...lift the cup up to her mouth and drink from it!
1333211.content:
"Are you hungry? I know I sure am. You're probably wondering what's in the basket on my back as well, I saw you looking at it earlier. It's a picnic basket," she takes it down. It's a rather small thing but packed to the brim with supplies. She begins to unfold a checkered red-and-white blanket that's on the very top and spreads it on the ground, carefully flattening out the bumps. "Climb on, don't be shy!"

The blanket is very soft under your paws and has a sweet smell to it. "Well, I am kind of hungry now that you mention it. But I was hoping to sort this size thing out first, though I see now you won't be able to help me."

"Oh, but I can help you! Well actually, I can't, but I do know someone who can! There's this scientist back in my village. He's a Snivy and he knows everything there is to know about potions and herbs and I'm sure he'll know what to do!" She pulls out a small metal flask and a teacup and sets them down on the blanket. "But, since I've already got everything ready, why don't we eat first? Since you're so cute and tiny even just a little bit of food will fill you up, won't it?"

You stare at the teacup fixedly. She was pouring ice cold tea into it and you were panting, not used to being on dry land for so long. "I...I could use a nice drink..."

"Oh!" she gasps and lowers the cup just as she's about to take a sip,"I feel so silly, you must feel like a fish out of water! Here, just climb in." She moves the cup towards you. A drop of the liquid splashes on your face and you lap it up. It tastes sweet.

"Are you sure it's OK? You really won't mind?" You grip the ear of the cup and pull yourself up to the brim, looking at Leafeon for affirmation.

"I don't mind at all! Jump right in!"

You don't hold back at all. The dark brown liquid feels icy on your skin and the relief is instant. There isn't much room to swim around in, but it's enough and it tastes delicious. Pulling your head out of the drink, you let out a contented sigh of happiness.

Leafeon begins to...
1333211.title: Leafeon wants to help you...

choices: Leafeon won't swallow you! She's just playing around! =D
13332111.content:
You float on your back without a care in the world. The Leafeon is humming a tune you don't know, and you hear the gentle sound of crinkling paper. The liquid's stillness is interrupted and you feel waves on your skin. You open your eyes and Leafeon's face takes up most of your view, larger than ever. Her fur is a bright sunny yellow, except for the tips of her ears which turn into green leaves. Her eyes are deep brown jewels, shiny and curious.

"Hey, you're not going to um...drink me are you?" you ask jokingly.

"Oh I don't know," her mouth widens into a playful smile as she brings the cup near her mouth, "maybe I will? Maybe I won't?"

"Ah, I would rather you don't!" you reply loudly. She knew I was joking, right?

She begins to tilt the cup and you grab hold of the porcelain brim anxiously. Leafeon's tongue comes out from between her lips and she playfully laps at the sweet liquid. The smooth red tongue manages to just touch the very tip of your blue tail, and you pull it away, hiding it between your legs.

She tilts the cup further and the level of the tea gradually lowers as she drinks it in. Your paws sweat in fear and you begin to lose grip on the rim. The tea no longer covers your body at all and you start to slip. First one paw, then the other, and you splash down into what little liquid remains in the bottom of the cup.

"Aaahhhh!" you yell as you slip down the smooth white wall and towards the Leafeon's open mouth.

Your cold hind paws touch her warm outstretched tongue and you stop momentarily. Your heart is beating wildly and you still hope to escape. But to no avail. Light becomes darkness and your body slips with ease between Leafeon's lips.

It's dark and warm and the air is a bit stale, but not smelly at all. The slick saliva-coated tongue below you undulates and presses you against the rippled roof of her mouth. She's playing with her food, you realize. Is that what you've become, her food?

You smack your large tail against her tongue as best as you can to get her attention. "Please don't swallow me!!" you yell, "I don't want to be digested!!"
13332111.title: ...lift the cup up to her mouth and drink from it!

choices: Dig in! The sandwich looks delicious!
Someone else appears and joins your picnic!
133321111.content:
"I was wondering what that awful fishy taste was!"

You lay in a gigantic crumpled napkin, coated from head to tail in sticky saliva and still shivering a bit from the harrowing ordeal you had just gone through.

"You...you tried to eat me!"

Inside the wet maw you had grabbed onto her tongue with had fought with all your might, absolutely refusing to be swallowed. The fight lasted minutes and she had finally given up and freed you. The whole experience had been a rude awakening to the downsides of being tiny.

"Oh! I would never dream of such a thing! I'm a vegetarian, I only eat vegetables and fruits! Honest!" The Leafeon was blushing and twirling a leaf of salad anxiously in her paws.

"Now wait just one minute! I asked you whether you were going to drink me and you clearly said 'Maybe I will, maybe I won't!', then you went ahead and did it! Now you're saying you're a vegetarian?" You felt brave, having caught her in a lie. Tiny, but brave.

"Ehh-heh-heh-heh..." She gave a nervous laugh, "Oh look! - I made us a sandwich!" She tossed the crumpled salad leaf she was restlessly wringing onto the two veggie-topped bread slices laying on a paper plate then joined them together. She dug around in the basket a short while and procured a small knife. "Aha!" She exclaimed, "one for meeee..." the knife sliced crisply through the bread, "and one for you!". You looked at the sandwich. Your appetite was still there, strangely enough and it did look quite good.

"My half's smaller..." It was a silly observation to make, you knew, as it was still three times your own height. You wouldn't be able to eat it in a week.

"Well that's because you're smaller! Now dig in!" Leafeon reached over to you and grabbed you by the tail, lifting you in the air! It didn't really hurt but it was rude, you thought. One does not just lift Vaporeons up by their tails.

You fell and plopped onto the soft white bread. Well at least she isn't going to try to eat you again, you thought, because this time she has her own sandwich. But still...
133321111.title: Leafeon won't swallow you! She's just p...

1333211112.content:
You sit on the big white bread slice and watch as the hungry Leafeon eats. She makes short work of her meal; her teeth rend the bread and veggies and large visible bulges go down her throat as she swallows. That could have been me you ponder uncomfortably.

When she's done she gets on all fours and stretches, yawning loudly. Her open mouth and teeth aren't something you're happy to see again.

"I'll be back in a little bit," she takes a couple napkins from a plate and begins to walk towards a thicket, "I have to pee."

"I...didn't need to know that." you reply, but realize she probably didn't hear. A distance that might have taken you an hour to cover takes her mere seconds and the golden grass-type eeveelution is soon gone from sight.

Once again you're alone. It's a good feeling, because at least when you're alone no one's going to eat you. However, your relief doesn't last very long; a rustling noise coming from the bushes startles you. You turn around slowly and see that it's another Pokemon! Who is it?
1333211112.title: Someone else appears and joins your picnic!

choices: Yes; you're going to be digested.
Maybe Leafeon will force Snivy to regurgitate you?
13332111121.content:
Pointy green snout, wide leafy tail, large orange eyes staring right at you; it could only be a Snivy.

"Well what have we here? A picnic all laid out, yet no picnickers? What a queer matter this is!" He lifts the empty teacup and tilts it upside down. A single drop drips out, "Alas, no tea. A tragedy. But what a grand sandwich that is. No one should miss it if I were to eat it, surely, lest it go to waste!"

No...no...NO! You had hidden yourself in between the pieces of bread while he had been inspecting the tea but now regretted it immensely. "Please don't eat me, just go away...", you repeat furiously under your breath. Without warning the giant leaves of lettuce bear down on you and the gravity shifts.

Snivy lifts the sandwich to his open mouth and takes a hefty bite. The vegetables crunch loudly as he chews.

"I say, this is quite fine!" His eyes move upwards and to the left as he chews and considers the taste with a connoisseur's tongue, "The hint of...fish...complements the texture of the cucumbers."

You feel your tail out in the open. The warmth of Snivy's breath is right on it. If he bites down one more time it'll be the end of me! Leafeon please hurry back! Please hurry back! Please hurry back!

The leaves squeeze down tightly again and in front of you, a great crunch. The pressure around your body loosens, only to increase again with much greater force. Am...am I inside his mouth? The smell of spittle and gnashing of teeth all around you confirms it. I am.

You wriggle out of the bolus of food and try the same trick that worked on Leafeon. You latch onto Snivy's tongue doing your best not to get your big clumsy tail in between the clamping teeth. It's not as easy as it sounds for Snivy's mouth is smaller than Leafeon's and much wetter. You can't see what you're doing either as he chews with his mouth closed.

Your grip starts to slip. Your tail becomes trapped in a lump of food. You yell but it's not loud enough to be heard. Suddenly the Snivy opens his mouth to take another bite. And for a moment you see Leafeon. Salvation!

Snivy's mouth closes; giant serpent swallows. You lose your grip and slide down the snake's tongue like the food that you are and enter a tighter passage that violently pulls you downwards and away from any hope of freedom. "NOOOOOOO! I was so close!" you yell in frustration.

The tight tunnel works you over and stops pulling you down for but a second. Your tail feels it first and then your hind paws. A blockage; or at least it was before it opens and you slip into the more capacious stomach. The stink of acid and bile hits you and your sensitive skin tingles as you splash down into the thick fluid. Quickly, you reach through the gunk and try to grab onto something. But there is nothing. I'm...I'm going to be digested aren't I?
13332111121.title: a hungry Snivy!

choices: There is no known medicine that can cure you. Sorry.
Snivy knows of some medicine to return you to normal size.
133321111212.content:
"Oh doctor Snivy what great fortune it is to meet you here! Vaporeon and I were just discussing you a while ago. No doubt you already know how to help him, being the great doctor that you are?"

Snivy swallows the bite he's chewing. "Ahem, do forgive my rudeness, I did not anticipate this picnic's participants to return, so I helped myself to this delicious sandwich." He looks guiltily backwards and around "Vaporeon you say? Am I to have had the pleasure to make his acquaintance that you speak so eagerly of him? I assure you, the only Pokemon that I see here is you, lady Leafeon."

Leafeon blushes at his kind words. He has a funny way of speaking; aristocratic in manner, she tries to imitate it whenever she's around him, just for fun. She sits down next to Snivy on the picnic blanket and puts her paws in her lap.

"Quite. He is a small blighter, a most unfortunate victim of some shrinking charm or what have you. He was seated on the very sandwich you now hold, last I saw of him. Surely you have seen him? Or is it that you've eaten him accidentally!" She laughs playfully and points at Snivy's belly.

"It could be the latter, I'm afraid." replies Snivy earnestly; Leafeon's smile fades and all is silent for a moment, "Tell me, this sandwich, was there any fish put into it? For I distinctly taste fish, and I know that you are not one to eat meat."

Leafeon turns serious very quickly. "My, you did eat him then! The taste you mention is the same I felt when I almost drank him, accidentally mind you, with my tea!"

"Well it seems our fishy friend is done for then, I'm afraid." He rubbed his round yellow belly, "there's no medicine I'm aware of that can save him now."

"Oh but surely you can bring him back up!" Leafeon pleads, "Regurigitate him if you must, you're a snake after all aren't you? Snakes are known to regurgitate their prey if the need comes of it?"

Snivy sighs. He stands up and places the unfinished portion of his sandwich back onto the plate. "What you say is true but it's not gentlemanly. However if you insist..."

"Oh but I do!"

"...then I will. I prefer not to be watched if you wouldn't mind."

～

You beat your paws on the stomach walls. It's pitch black and you can feel the stinging on your skin growing stronger. Between the loud beats of Snivy's heart you could hear that Leafeon was talking to Snivy and he was replying back, his voice much louder and coming from above. You just hope that Leafeon managed to talk him into barfing you back out. You hope and hope that that's what they were saying, because you have no more energy left to stand. Your head begins to slowly slip below the acid...

Suddenly the walls surrounding you come together with a lurch and you submerse completely under the liquid. Food and flesh violently brush against your skin and it hurts even more now that it's so raw. Then you see light. You see the blue of sky and the green of grass rushing towards you.

～

"I hope my humble apology will be accepted," green fingers dig underneath you and lift you from the wet grass up to a large orange eye; the big serpent Pokemon inspects you with in professional sincerity, "had I known you were playing at hide-and-seek inside a sandwich I assure you I would not have eaten you! Though I digress; the blame lies solely upon me, Doctor Snivy, healer of ailments and crasher of picnics."

"You...you ate me!" You could just muster up enough strength to pull yourself up and shout angrily.

"Doctor! Oh good doctor!" Leafeon rushes to his side and looks at you "Tell me, can he be cured? Do you know of some medicine to bring him back to his original size?"
133321111212.title: Maybe Leafeon will force Snivy to regurgitate you?

choices: A giant Arcanine ambushes your group!
1333211112122.content:
"It just so happens that there is a potion that might help poor Vaporeon." Snivy rises and begins to help Leafeon pack up the picnic supplies into the basket. You sit atop Leafeon's head and hold onto the leaf coming from her forehead. "In my many years of work with exotic herbs I have managed to extract a certain compound from a certain plant that causes nigh-instant bodily growth. I've tested it only once, to disastrous effects mind you, on an Arcanine. My calculations must have been off or maybe my subject drank too much of it because it grew to the size of a house. While in my laboratory! Needless to say, countless bottles were smashed and years of research was lost, but I never forgot the recipe for the potion. It's locked up in here," he tapped his forehead with a pointy finger "for who knows what damage might come about if it came into the hands of the wrong person."

"And what became of him? The Arcanine that is?" Leafeon finished folding up the blanket and pushed it inside the basket. The fit was tight.

"A potion of reversal has eluded even my wits. I had to let him free. He roams these very woods, to this day perhaps. This way, my dear. This road is the shortest way to the laboratory."

The three of you walk along the forest trail. Well, two walk. Leafeon on all fours, a miniscule Vaporeon licking its burns and laying on her back, and a Snivy to her side carrying a basket atop his head with its tendrils.

"How're, you holding up, Vaporeon?" Leafeon asked, genuinely concerned.

"A bit dry but I think I'll be fine. Is the laboratory much farther?"

"It's right up ahead." replied Snivy.
1333211112122.title: Snivy knows of some medicine to return you to n...

choices: You drink too much, and become huge.
You drink just enough, and return to normal size.
13332111121221.content:
Row after row of phials and flasks line the shelves of the small wooden house. Drying leaves and fruits hang by the windows; chemicals of every color flow briskly through pipes and test tubes. Snivy brings a very large and dusty tome off a shelf in his library and lays it on a workbench. He brushes the cover clean; it's inscribed in strange symbols that you don't recognize.

"Ah yes," Snivy said as he browses the pages of the book. "This is the one. See the footprint?"

"Is that from Arcanine?"

"The same."

You peer over Leafeon's shoulder. A huge black ink smudge covers two spread pages. In fact, it would have covered more than two pages as it was only part of the footprint.

"The recipe for the growth potion is underneath the ink. Completely illegible, yes, but I have it stored in my mind just the same. I should have all the ingredients I need laying around. Finding them, however, shall take me a while."

Snivy walks brusquely back and forth through the room, looking into shelves, cupboards, boxes and chests. Sometimes pulling out a dried leaf and putting it back only to pull out an identical leaf from a chest elsewhere.

Leafeon reaches a paw over to you and gestures; you climb on. She brings you to her face and smiles kindly. "You're going to be big again, I just know it! Snivy's a really good doctor and he's never had a patient die on him!"

"There's always a first time!" Snivy answers while reaching behind a bookshelf to retrieve a paper that had fallen there.

"Err..." Leafeon was nonplused. "Tell me," she says changing the topic of discussion, "you still want to be friends when everything's back to normal? Can you forgive me for trying to eat you?"

The honest answer is no, but you don't want to hurt her feelings. "Yes, of course I forgive you, Leafeon! Friends forgive each other don't they?" Leafeon smiles widely and pets you on the head. It still stings a bit but you smile back, glad to have sealed a friendship.

"Oi, we'll be hosting a Vaporeon before the hour is up; I'll be needing several buckets of fresh water and a pool to put them in! With haste!" You look towards where Snivy was speaking and see him directing his orders to a shy young Absol you had not noticed before. He was carrying a flask of blue liquid but had set it down upon receiving the order.

"I'm sorry where are my manners. Leafeon, Vaporeon, this is Absol my apprentice. A studious youth and knowledgeable on all fronts of medicine and herbalism. One day he might just succeed me in accomplishments but today, he will fetch water."

Upon Absol's departure from the house-slash-laboratory, Snivy closes the curtains and produces a key which he then proceeds to use on a secret keyhole behind a painting. "The final ingredient," he whispers "very powerful. Can't have my assistance knowing of it. Not yet at least."

From an aged yellow envelope he pulls out a single leaf. It's small and fragile. "Holocopis gigantum," Snivy says proudly, as if it's supposed to mean something to either of you, "also known as Giant's Bane. A very rare plant indeed. Not found on this island, nor any island nearby for that matter. Only the most archaic of books mention it, and briefly at that. I happened upon such a rarity purely by chance, you see."

He carefully snapped off a tiny fragment of the leaf and dropped it into a test tube of orange liquid. The liquid began to bubble.

"I am a collector of antique books, as you no doubt can see. My collection is vast and bears archaic and forbidden knowledge. Some of these tomes are written in tongues that haven't been spoken for a thousand years or more. In one such book, which I had bought from a wandering peddler of strange goods, I found this beauty. The matter of how I uncovered her, however, is in itself not so magnificent. You see, I had fallen asleep while reading. When I woke up I discovered to my great dismay that my book had fallen to the floor and the delicate spine had broken. It was a fortunate act, however, as in the spine was hidden a bundle of herbs with this leaf among it. I quickly cracked open the spines of all the other books I owned as well. A shame, to ruin such old books, especially since none others had such a hidden cache. However, I am drifting from the point. The potion looks ready."

The potion indeed did look ready. It had changed from orange to a purplish hue. You walk to the end of Leafeon's paw and she places you on top of a stool.

"Is it really ready? Can I drink it and return to normal?"

"You may and you will," said Snivy "However, perhaps only take a little sip. We don't want to have another Arcanine incident, do we?"

Snivy pours the potion into a saucer and you cautiously stick you tongue in. It doesn't taste very pleasant. You begin to drink and you feel a strange vibration ring through your body.
13332111121221.title: You reach the laboratory.

choices: You follow Leafeon. She has something fun planned.
You suggest finding the Absol assistant as a way of thanking Snivy for his help.
133321111212212.content:
The myriad items strewn around you begin to shrink as you grow. The saucer that you're drinking from gets smaller, and smaller, until you realize it's not a saucer at all but merely a jar lid.

"Is this enough? Do I look normal sized to you now?" There is still a good amount of potion left in the lid.

"If you would please elevate your head," says Snivy, holding in one hand a hardbound Pokedex open to the page on Vaporeons and in the other a meterstick, "head a little higher...higher...that's it. Let's see...one meter and...two centimeters."

"Is that normal?" Leafeon asks, curiously.

"The average height of a Vaporeon is one meter," Snivy taps a pointy green finger on the page, "so he is well within the standard deviation."

"Yay! You're back to normal! I knew Snivy could help your!" Leafeon smiles in delight and playfully jumps towards you, arms outspread. Her hug catches you off guard but you're glad to be normal again.

"Thank you Snivy, and thank you Leafeon too. If it weren't for you two I don't know what I would have done." No chance of me being mistaken for food now, you think thankfully.

Smiling back at the two happy eeveelutions, Snivy shuts the old Pokedex loudly and puts the envelope of herbs back into its hiding place before walking towards a window and peering behind the curtain.

"Strange Absol, he always gets lost, you know? A terrible sense of direction I'm afraid. He should have been back with the water by now."

"Oh it's alright, I'm not really that thirsty anymore. The potion was kind of refreshing, really."

"Is that so. Well then, my work here is done it seems. No doubt both of you will want to get back to your adventures now."

"Yes, I have a lot I want to show him! Vaporeon, you'll come with me, won't you?"

"Oh, sure! Of course I will."

"Great!" Leafeon walks towards the door and opens it, and you follow her.

"Ahem," Snivy clears his throat, "Should you find my assistant along your way, do tell him to return won't you?"

"Will do!" you yell back before you close the laboratory door and step out into the sunny green field.
133321111212212.title: You drink just enough, and return to normal size.

choices: Stay in the stomach as she keeps eating
133321112.content:
From inside the mouth you feel a tremor as Leafeon giggles. The tongue began to rise and you found yourself sliding down into her throat. You are pressed into the fleshy tube and pushed down quickly, with crushing pressure around you until you slip easily into a larger space filled with the tea from before. Only your head is above the liquid in the cramped stomach, and there's little air to breath, but luckily you can breath underwater, and the tea contained enough of it to last for some time.
You hear a pounding sound from outside the stomach as Leafeon patted her belly. "I hope you like it in there little guy!"
133321112.title: Leafeon will swallow you! ^o^

133331.content:
You look down at yourself and sigh with relief - you're still an Espeon. Same short, purple fur, same paws, same forked tail, same huge ears, same gender, different size.

You decide to make a plan, it's better to think things out rather than just running off. You decide that you need to find or make a shelter where you can spend the night first, then maybe find some berries and...

Your ears suddenly perk up. You had been hearing a sound while you were thinking, a sort of quick, dull thud, over and over again. You had just ignored it before, but it had been getting louder and louder until you couldn't block it out anymore. You also realise that some of the little bits of dirt around you are starting to shake with each thud. You feel a bit stupid for not paying attention to your surroundings at your current size, so, better late than never, you turn around to see what it is.

Walking towards you along the dirt path is a ninetales, a REGULAR SIZED ninetales. It's absolutely massive! And, although it's only strolling, it's approaching you extremely fast from your point of view! You don't have enough time to move out of the way; it's right on top of you! Instead, you begin shouting for all your worth, trying to get its attention before it's too late...
133331.title: Espeon

1333312.content:
You shout and shout, trying to catch the colossal fox pokemon's attention, but it simply cannot hear you. You might as well be trying to speak to a skyscraper. You watch with dismay and fear as an enormous golden-furred paw swings into the air far above you, then drops down towards you.

You close your eyes as the paw hits your tiny body. Your legs buckle sideways and are pushed out from underneath you, pressed flat to the floor as the paw pushes against you. Plain side up. You'll be spending the night inside his butt. As good a place as any, you figure. Now how to get up there? Snores from the giant Ninetales echo in the cave. Good, you think to yourself, at least he won't be minding what I'm about to do.

Maybe you can climb up the kitsune's fur? You give it a shot, clenching tightly a lock of golden fur and to the best of your ability attempt to pull yourself up. It doesn't quite work; the fur simply slips in between your clumsy Espeon paws. But this doesn't stop you. You try again. And then again. Alas, the best you manage to do is to pull your centimetre-tall self up half your own height before you drop, landing on your butt, your tail slightly cushioning the fall. Curse these clumsy paws.

Oh...well obviously! You facepaw yourself at having once again overlooked an obvious solution. There is a certain move, one you have not quite yet mastered, but that would help you greatly if you could perform it. You've only done it once before successfully. Well, half-successfully. It is quite difficult because it is a technique that combines both levitation and paralysis, the result being that you can fly and whatever tries to touch you becomes temporarily paralysed. The last time that you attempted this move was when you were in a fight with a Swellow. You managed to fly after, and paralyse the bird-like Pokemon for a few seconds, but then your aura of power failed for whatever reason and you fell headlong into a quick-moving stream. No one won the fight that day, but you were the laugh of the forest.

Oh well, it's worth a try. You sit down, close your eyes, empty your mind and begin to focus your psychic energy. A dim yellow aura starts to grow near the centre of your body. You focus more deeply and the sphere grows, eventually large enough to surround your body. This yellow aura is, as you know, the levitation sphere. Now you refocus your energy up higher, towards your throat. This aura would be blue, but since it is already inside the yellow aura the colors combine and an orb of green light begins to expand outwards. This is the paralysis aura and, slowly but surely, the green aura eventually matches the diameter of the formerly yellow sphere. Now comes the tricky part. You quickly refocus your energy away from your throat and into your heart. A faint hiss, followed by a pop, signifies the auras have locked together successfully. The misty power extends no further than necessary to the edges of your body. You know you shouldn't make it too big, or else it might not fit into the Ninetales.

That was...actually pretty straightforward, you think to yourself. Never before have you managed the difficult manoeuvre with such ease. Maybe being in the presence of a fire Pokemon had something to do with it? No, that was nonsense. I'm just stronger is all, you instead think, grinning. Or...maybe since I'm so tiny the amount of skill needed for the aura was proportionally as tiny. Your momentary smile fades at this far more likely explanation.

You take to the matter at hand and begin to levitate yourself upwards. Up you go, the dim green light of the aura glistening on the shiny pink flesh of the Ninetale's rather large pucker. You blush a deep shade of red and look away from the huge pink vagina in front of you. Sure, it's hot, but she's a complete stranger, and you're not even the same size, let alone the same species.

You turn and begin to walk away from her. This isn't your cave, you have no right to be in here. You do need a place to spend the night, though... No. What good are morals if you abandon them as soon as the going gets tough? You look up at the sleeping golden fox pokemon as you walk past her face. She's beautiful, you wish you could meet her again one day, when you get back to normal.

Suddenly, her huge eyes snap open, a look of surprise quickly turning to anger crosses them as their red gaze focuses on you. You leap back in shock, fear growing inside you, paralysing you on the spot. What would she think of an intruder to her home? This can't end well... Sure enough, she growls at you menacingly, revealing her colossal, sharp rows of teeth.

You feel your ears and tail droop, and you gulp as you cower away from her, shaking with fright. She blinks with confusion and stops growling as she takes in your size and body language. Her expression then changes to one of...
13333122.title: Female

133331221.content:
You are still cowering on the floor with your eyes shut expecting to die at any second, when you hear a gentle female voice say "Hey". You slowly open your eyes and look up at the giantess timidly, still shaking uncontrollably. You can see her face, and she is grimacing apologetically down at you. "I'm sorry for scaring you so badly, I didn't expect you to be so small!" She leans forwards and nuzzles gently against your body. You gradually stop shaking as her warm golden fur rubs against you comfortingly.

She draws her head back to a more natural position. You feel a lot better now that she has shown that she doesn't want to hurt you; you even find the courage to walk up to her, still slightly shakily, and sit between her forepaws. She grins down at you in delight. You clear your throat shyly, then introduce yourself. Thankfully, her sharp hearing means you don't have to shout. "I'm sorry," she says, "but I'll never remember your name. Everyone here just calls each other by species. I'm called ninetales".

"So how did you get into my cave?" she asks with a tiny hint of annoyance. You tell her everything that's happened to you so far today, up until reaching her cave. Her jaw drops open when you tell her that she stepped on you. "Oh my God, are you alright?" she asks, genuinely concerned about you. "I never even realised... I mean, I would never..." You assure her that you are totally unharmed, and conclude with the fact that you are lost and alone, 1cm tall and you have nowhere to spend the night.

"Well, you can stay here for as long as you want to," she responds. "Don't argue," she says as she sees you open your mouth. You shut it again. "After all, the least I can do is give you somewhere to live. Now, where can you sleep...?" She seems lost in thought for a minute, before her ears perk up and she grins down at you again. "I know! You can sleep in..."
133331221.title: Kindness

1333312211.content:
Your eyes widen in shock and you take a step back. You search for signs that she's joking, but find none. "It's alright, you'll be completely safe in there!" she coaxes. You catch glimpses of her proposed sleeping location as she speaks. "Look, it's all soft and warm in here!" She opens her jaws wide, showing you her pink flesh and tongue. It's true, it does look soft and warm. The things that your worried about are the pulsing, powerful throat at the back and the massive, sharp teeth lining the edges.

Sensing your uneasiness and hesitation, she closes her mouth and locks her red eyes onto your purple ones. "Listen, Espeon - I wouldn't be suggesting this if I didn't think you'd be perfectly safe. Trust me, I promise it'll be okay." Looking up into her eyes, you see a deep sincerity to her words, and after a few seconds of reasoning with yourself, you accept.

Ninetales giggles happily, then sticks out her pink tongue and licks you up quickly, leaving you in the middle of her vast maw. At first you cringe down instinctively, struggling to overcome your instincts, but eventually get yourself to loosen up and look around. She was right about it being warm and soft, your paws have gently sunken into her tongue a short way. You lift one up, and watch as a sticky saliva string forms between it and the pink muscle beneath you. You see the huge teeth around you, huge white spikes locked together to form a cage around you. At first you thought of it as trapping you inside, but you are now coming to think of it as a protective cage. They are cleaner than you thought they would be. Warm air drifts up from the throat behind you in soft blasts. Her breath doesn't smell bad, but more like regular air with a hint of berries and - you shiver slightly - raw meat.

Ninetales giggles again around your body, then opens her maw once again to speak. She manages to keep her tongue fairly level so that you don't fall off as she says "Good night, Espeon." She yawns before closing her mouth around you again, then rests her head on her paws and drifts swiftly off to sleep. You yawn yourself, then curl up in the middle of her tongue. You don't mind her saliva, at worst it's mildly annoying you by matting down your short fur. Eventually, listening to your new friend's steady breathing, you drop off to sleep yourself.
1333312211.title: "My mouth!"

choices: Go for a walk and get to know the local area
Go and get something for breakfast
13333122111.content:
You awake the next morning with a start, which isn't helped by the fact that you are surrounded by flesh and teeth. You begin to panic, before the previous day's memories come flooding back to you. You are quite annoyed to find yourself still only 1cm tall, but you feel safer once you remember Ninetales. It was nice of her to look after you like this, you think to yourself as you stretch out across her soft tongue. Your front paws slide a bit in the saliva on the surface of her tongue, and sink into it slightly. You let out a yawn before collecting yourself back together into a more natural position, and wait for her to wake up.

You don't have to wait very long. Only a few minutes have passed when you feel a slight shift in the gravity of your 'bedroom'. Light pours in as she opens her jaws in a yawn of her own. Once she has finished you call out, "morning, Ninetales!"
"Mmmm, good morning, Espeon..." her reply vibrates through you and the rest of her mouth. The gravity shifts again, and then the sharp teeth around you separate as her tongue rolls out of her maw and onto the floor, allowing you to slide down.

The stone floor of the cave seems to feel wrong beneath your paws - it's hard and dry. You shake the majority of the saliva out of your fur, then smile up at Ninetales, who is watching you fondly. "Looks like someone could do with a bath!" she exclaims before extending her tongue once again. You hop onto it and it draws you back inside of her. You don't mind so much now, you are getting used to being inside her mouth. You feel her getting up and walking, presumably out of her cave. Only a few seconds later, she opens her jaws again and you fall straight into cold water. You surface gasping for breath; you hadn't been prepared. Looking around, you see that you are in a mountain spring, judging by the mountain that it is connected to. The cave is just a short way along the face of the mountain.

Ninetales climbs gently into the spring beside you, careful not to disturb you or create ripples which could drown you. You swim over to her and press against her for warmth. She notices you shivering, and thinks for a moment before smiling down at you. Using her fire abilities, she begins to create heat inside her body, which quickly spreads to the water around you. Soon the entire spring is heated to a comfortable bathing temperature. She grins down at you again. "Better?" she enquires. You stick your tongue out at her and then dive under the surface of the water. You are a strong swimmer despite not being a water type, and can hold your breath for quite long. While you're under, you take advantage of the fact that the water is now all around you and scrub off all of the saliva that was coating your fur. It doesn't take long, and you quickly resurface.

After a few minutes of swimming together, Ninetales asks if you want to get out now. You agree, but before she can climb out of the water, your ask her to wait. Taking advantage of the fact that her head is now at the same level as yours, you climb onto her muzzle and up onto her head. You shake the water out of your fur, then tell her that you're ready. She swims to the edge of the water and climbs out. You can now see the world from the same perspective that you used to. "Hold on tight up there, Espeon!" she shouts up to you suddenly. By now you have learned that when you're this small, you should follow that kind of instruction as fast as possible. You lay flat on her head and grab a mouthful of her fur. She then shakes off the water from her body, and although she moves her head as little as possible, you still nearly fall off the edge.

"Was that really necessary?" you ask as you recover from the dizziness.
"Yep," she giggles. You roll your eyes, and then ask what you're going to do now. "Well, usually I either go for a walk or look for some breakfast at this time in the morning," she crosses her eyes upwards in a futile attempt to look at you. "Are you feeling hungry, Espeon?"
13333122111.title: The next day...

133331221112.content:
"Yes, very," you reply. Your stomach growls loudly in agreement, and you both laugh. You realise that since you don't know how long you were unconscious for, you can't tell how long it's been since you last ate.
"Well then, I know exactly where we can go get some berries!" Ninetales exclaims, still giggling slightly, before setting off into the forest.

As the two of you make your way through the forest, you find that you are noticing different things than you normally would, if you were normal sized,
such as where the drops of dew form on the petals of the flowers, and tiny cave-like knot-holes in the tree trunks.
"Do you have a favourite berry, Espeon?" asks Ninetales brightly. You think for a moment, then reply "sitrus berries".
"That's lucky, there's plenty of those. I prefer hondew berries myself, but they're almost impossible to get..." she trails off wistfully.

Just a few moments later, you enter a large clearing, and all around the edges and dotted throughout are various berry bushes and trees. You can see what Ninetales meant about the sitrus berries, those are everywhere. Ninetales walks up to one of the sitrus bushes and lowers herself to the floor, allowing you to slide off from her head. You walk up to the bush and find a berry growing near the ground, several times your size. You bite into it, savoring it's sweet flavour, then pull it from the bush and drag it back to Ninetales, who is watching you with interest. Despite its size, the berry isn't very heavy at all, and it doesn't take you tong to get to her. You take bites from the berry until you are full, and offer the rest to her. She licks it up and swallows it without even chewing - it's almost as if she's showing off.

You clamber back onto her head again and sit up between her ears. She gets up and begins walking towards a tall tree near the edge of the clearing. You can see that it is covered with hondew berries, and why Ninetales doesn't get to eat them very often: it's far too tall for her to reach. She sits down at the bottom of the tree and sighs. "It doesn't look like any have fallen down today..." she says with deep disappointment. However, you aren't really paying much attention. You are thinking about your psychic powers, and wondering to yourself... have your powers changed in strength along with your size? Can you now use your powers in relation to your size, or in relation to your old size?

Ninetales sighs again, and turns to walk away. "Wait," you say suddenly, and she stops, tries to look at you, fails, then turns back.
"Why?" she asks with surprise.
Rather than answer your question, you simply say "I want you to sit very still near the trunk of that hondew tree". Ninetales obeys, and sits silently back down facing the tree. Now that you're both sitting still, you can focus. You select a particularly juicy-looking berry from one of the lowest branches, picture it in your mind for a good few seconds, then close your eyes and concentrate.

The gem in your forehead glows faintly and the fluff on your cheeks and your ears stand up and straighten themselves out as the psychic energy flows out of you. You hear a small, distant snap, then Ninetales gasps in a mixture of shock and delight. You can feel the weight of the berry pressing down on your mind as you guide it slowly through the air, and smile to yourself - it's just as you had hoped; the berry weighed almost nothing to you, which meant that your powers hadn't changed at all. More confident now in your own abilities, you open your eyes to watch as the berry gracefully floats and dances through the air towards you. You swing it down alongside Ninetales' head and hop onto it, and ride it down to the floor in front of Ninetales.

Looking up at her face, you find that Ninetales is staring at you open-mouthed, as though she can't quite believe that you just plucked a berry that was the same size as you from a tree several hundred times your height. Well, it is pretty unbelievable, but that's just psychic powers for you. You grin back up at her and hop off from the berry. "I thought you would like one, in return for everything you've done for me," you explain in a matter-of-fact voice. She smiles down at you appreciatively, then eats it, clearly savoring it's flavour. Eventually, she finds her voice and says "That... was so cool.
133331221112.title: Berries for breakfast

1333312211122.content:
"Do it again! What else can you lift?" Ninetales asks exitedly.
"I don't actually know. That's the first thing I've tried lifting since I shrunk," you reply thoughtfully. "Although I used to be able to lift boulders twice my size".
"Lift something else! Pleasepleasepleeeeease!!"
You can't help but laugh at her, she seems like a child asking their parents to buy them something. Looking around, you see a stone and several assorted berries lying around. You stare at them, then close your eyes and picture each one individually.

You open your eyes again and watch as each one floats into the air. You bring them towards you and send them circling slowly around Ninetales' head, each one revolving itself at the same time. Ninetales just stares awe-struck at the multi-coloured halo around her and breathes the word "wow..." You spin them faster and faster until they become a blurred ring, then suddenly stop them all in place and gently lower them to the floor.

"That was amazing..." breathes Ninetales, almost as if hypnotised by the memory of the colourful halo. You grin at her, then say "hold on tight, Ninetales". You expel a massive amount of energy through the air and go as still as a statue with the sheer concentration. After a moment Ninetales lets out a startled "eep!" as her paws lift slowly from the grass. She is stunned silent as she gracefully floats into the air, revolving around slowly as her body drifts away from the ground. She begins to giggle with glee as she hangs there, completely unsupported save for your mind.

You give her one last revolution before gently pulling her back down to earth. As her paws touch the ground, you release her from your power and walk casually over to her. "Was that really necessary?" she asks, still giggling from the experience.
"Yep," you reply as you hop onto the stone from earlier and hitch a lift to her head. She laughs as you both set off back towards the cave.

13333122111221.content:
You and Ninetales set off again, you perched between her ears as she walks back out of the clearing, still giggling from her brief flight. As you leave the clearing, a glint of grey catches your eye, in stark contrast with the natural bright colours of the forest. "Wait," you tell her. "What's that?"
"What?" She replies, slowing to a stop.
You slide down onto her muzzle, where she can see you, and gesture to where you saw the grey. "That." You are worried that the flash may have been from the fur or skin of a forest-dwelling pokemon, a mightyena perhaps. If it can sneak up on you, it could take you both down as if you were its prey...
"Oh, that," she says as she turns and walks towards it. You abandon your previous fears, as Ninetales clearly doesn't see this thing as a threat. "I was going to show you this, but I got distracted by being lifted off the ground by amazing psychic powers". She giggles again as you blush slightly behind your fur. She walks around a tree that was blocking your view, so that you can see the thing.

Or things, actually, six in total. They are all made of stone, five smaller pillar-like ones around one large one. "It's an obelisk," explains Ninetales. "Each pillar represents a different thing. Fire, water, air, earth and energy." You pull a leaf from a nearby tree and bring it up next to you, then ride it down to the floor. You approach the nearest pillar. Ninetales follows you up to it, and as you approach it, you begin to feel warmer as heart radiates outwards from it. "This is the pillar of fire," she tells you. "They go around in the order I told you them in, in a clockwise order".
"What's the one in the middle?" You ask as you approach it. It looks different to the others, it rises above them, and is more slab-like.
"This one represents Arceus, the god of all pokemon. It is said that he watches over and protects the beings in the forrest from this spot, and is even able to bring back the dead and make pokemon immortal," comes the informative reply, "although he first judges their lives to see if they are worthy. There was only ever one pokemon who became immortal this way, but no-one has ever proved it. They say that it was a little Pichu who was being hunted and killed for fun by vicious pokemon. When he died, Arceus pitied him, and brought his soul here, building him a new body and giving him another chance. And they say that any time he died again, his body would just be rebuilt here, and he would just leave again," Ninetales concluded her speech.

You stand in awed silence for a few seconds, then ask if it's ever happened since.
"Not that I know of," Ninetales replies. The two of you stand there for a few more moments, then Ninetales says "Anyway, we should carry on home now". You leap back onto your leaf and ferry yourself back onto Ninetales' head, sit down and get comfortable as she sets off again. The conversation soon changes back to the subject of your "incredible" psychic powers, and before you know it, you're back at the cave. What do you do next?

Ninetales walks into the clearing in front of her cave and lays down happily on a patch of grass near the pool of spring water, which is currently reflecting the sky perfectly in its glassy stillness. She lays her head on the ground between her forepaws, allowing you to slide down to the grass beneath you. You turn around to smile back up at her, and notice - for a fraction of a second before she could hide it from you - an anxious look in her eyes.
"Something the matter?" You ask her.
"No, it's nothing," she replies far too quickly, almost cutting off your question with her answer.
"Come on, you can tell me," you say, calmly adding, "otherwise I'll have to read your mind."
Her eyes light up with excitement. "You can read minds?!"
"Yes, I can," you reply. You are half-lying here: you can't read minds, but you can read active thoughts, such as what people are about to say. The trick is to get people to think about what you want to know from them.
"What number am I thinking of?" She almost barks in excitement, subtly changing the subject.
You sit down facing her. "36," you inform her. She gasps, almost as though she wasn't expecting you to get it right. She opens her mouth to continue talking, but you aren't letting her out of this so easily. "Stop changing the subject and tell me what you were thinking about just now".
She sighs. "Okay, fine". She takes a deep breath and exhales slowly. "It was a question, actually...

It was the sitrus berry that got me thinking, I could swallow it easily, and it was several times your size, so I could easily swallow you without hurting you at all... I was just worried about what you would think of me for saying it out loud. I didn't know how you'd react, I didn't know if you'd be scared or angry or if you'd think I was weird or..."

By now she has worked herself into such a state that her voice is shaking and she's almost in tears. You get up and walk deliberately up to her muzzle and, standing on your two back paws, slide your two tiny forepaws onto her tongue. For a second she is shocked silent by your gesture, and slides her tongue out further in reflex. You nuzzle against the slick pink surface, purring softly as you rub your face across it. "Would you be able to get me out in time?" you ask her softly. Ninetales blinks a few times, and a wide grin spreads across her muzzle as she registers the meaning of your words.
"Yes, of course! Watch!" She draws her head back from you, causing you to drop to the floor as she carefully slides her tongue out from under you. She bends her head down, coughs a few times, then a very slimy object drops to the ground in front of you. It is your sitrus berry, completely unchanged from the last time you saw it (except for the thick coating of saliva, of course). "See? I can control my entire digestive system almost completely. It's kinda like a party trick".

Without further ceremony, Ninetales gleefully licks you up with her slimy tongue and draws you into her maw. She begins to lick you all over, clearly savouring your taste, but also sufficiently wetting you for your journey down her waiting throat. It flies past you at an amazing rate, and you feel adrenaline building up in your system, loving every second of it.

You soon come flying out into a large chamber which you assume to be her stomach. "I'm here!" You call out to her as you stand up and get orientated. The stomach walls suddenly light up and glow a bright orange, illuminating your "room" for you. Ninetales must have used her fire abilities to provide you with a little light. Your world suddenly flips upside down as Ninetales rolls onto her back. You see the new ceiling bulge inwards as you assume she rubs her stomach with satisfaction.

13531.content: You gaze up at the gigantic world around you. You had no words for what you saw. Your jaw hung open for almost a solid minute as you tried to recollect yourself of what happened. "Wh-What..." You finally manage to sputter out. The grass all around were like trees. You tried to see above the grass-lime, but at your new micro size, that wasn't possible. You huff and rub your head, and think over the events that occurred prior to your minimizing. After a few minutes of thinking, all you could remember was a bright flash of light, then you passed out. "What am I going to do now?" You ask yourself. Suddenly a loud noise grabbed your attention, it was rather faint, but it was loud enough to make your head perk up. Again, the same loud noise pierced your eardrums, but this time the ground under you shook a little, and the noise seemed to be getting longer. Then once more, the loud noise came again, except this time, it sounding like a hundred thunderstorms. You tried to go and cover your ears, but the ground shook viciously, causing you to be thrown onto your back. You quickly recover back up onto your feet. You quickly decide to evaluate the current situation you were in, fortunately, your quick thinking concluded that your minimized size, plus the constant loud noises could mean that a Pokemon was coming your way. However, on the flip side, being this could be bad, what if the Pokemon didn't see you? Your thoughts stopped when the sun was suddenly covered up, leaving you in shade. You gaze up to see the paw of a Pokemon come down right in front of you! To you it seemed to be a few meters away, but because you were so small, it actually only a few inches away. You were filled to the brim with adrenaline, and in the heat of the moment, so making out the Pokemon the paw belonged to wasnt your main priority. You needed to make a decision, fast! In your spilt second thought, you decided to...

info.brief_description: My first interactive, in which you are devoured by pokemon!
info.description:
My first interactive story! ^^

------------
Basically, this is a story set on an island in the middle of nowhere, inhabited by all the pokemon between the first and fifth generations (all that exist at this point), and you have been shrunk to 1cm tall for no apparent reason. You can be either a human or a pokemon, but you always start out at 1cm. You can change size during the story, but you can only become a giant yourself if you start as a pokemon. If you are killed by a pokemon, you can reform/re-spawn.

~~ ABBREVIATED RULES ~~

A shortened version of the rules in case the full list is a little bit too long.

Anything goes, vore-wise; no anthros; 2nd person; good spelling and grammar; no human preds; keep the spare option in "what pokemon are you" open, or "other"; be descriptive; pokemon can't speak to people.

A full explanation of each rule is listed below.

--RULES--

1. This is an adult vore and macro story, so you can have oral vore, anal vore, cock vore, breast vore (on the anthro pokemon, more on that later), tail vore (obviously only if the pokemon has a tail), unbirth, sex (if you can make it work between macros and micros), paw, stomp, anything goes.

2. No anthros, unless the pokemon is anthro normally, such as lucario or gardevoir. Female anthros have breasts.

3. Keep the story in the second person, present tense (for example, "you wake up", not "he woke up").

4. Please use good spelling and grammar, and write at least a paragraph per chapter, if possible.

5. Only have pokemon doing the vore and growing. Sorry, but humans aren't allowed to grow.

6. Once the pokemon line in the "what are you" chapter (selecting what pokemon you are) goes down to two options per chapter, leave the second option as "other". This is just so that you can be any of the 600 or so pokemon if you want to.

7. Please try to make it descriptive, especially the macro and vore parts. Just having "it eats you" stuck in a chapter doesn't feel satisfying to read, does it? Just imagine what it would feel, sound and look like to be eaten alive, and the entire chapter would instantly liven up!

8. You can only speak to pokemon if you are a pokemon.

And finally, have fun! That's what there stories are for.

If there are only a few minor grammar or spelling errors in your chapter, I am willing to edit them. Unless I am REALLY, REALLY BORED, I will delete chapters with far too many errors. If I can't work out what you are trying to say, I will usually delete the chapter.

If a chapter breaks the rules, I will remove it.
